answer.explanation: Welcome to WBY Radio’s weekly small business report. Q1 Our first story is about recent developments in Rider Industries, the country’s leading manufacturer of cleaning supplies. Q2 Last year Rider’s market research team found that many consumers preferred to use products that are safe for the environment. As a result, Rider introduced a line of all-natural cleaning supplies. The new line of Green products has been so successful that Rider’s sales have gone up by 19 percent. Q3 The company forecasts even greater profits after it launches a digital and print advertising campaign in September.

question.text: What does Rider Industries make?
What do customers like about the new line of merchandise?
choices: (D) It comes in a variety of sizes.

question.text: According to the speaker, what will happen in September?
choices: (A) A live radio interview will be held.
(B) An advertising campaign will be launched.
(C) An international trade show will take place.
(D) A company-wide training program will begin.

answer.text: (B) An advertising campaign will be launched.

answer.explanation: Q1 I called this staff meeting to tell you about some changes we’ve made here at the stationery store in preparation for the start of the school year. Q1&2 We’re arranged displays with our best selling items like pens and notebooks towards the front of the store to make them easier for shoppers to find. And speaking of popular items, a lot of customers will be looking for pencil cases, and I’m aware there aren’t many in stock. Q3 I ordered more from our supplier a month ago, but it’s a busy time of year. There’s really nothing we can do, so please ask customers to come back at a later time.

question.text: What type of merchandise does the store sell?
Why have store displays been rearranged?
choices: (C) To make space for discounted stock
(D) To make popular items more accessible

answer.text: (D) To make popular items more accessible

question.text: What does the speaker imply when she says, “it’s a busy time of year”?
choices: (C) A delivery service has been successful.

answer.explanation: My name is Ned, and I’ll be your guide on today’s zoo tour. The fenced pathways will lead us past areas where our animals are allowed to roam free. Q1 I’m sure you’ll be impressed with the natural habitats that have been carefully recreated for our zoo animals to live in. Q2 At the end of the tour, we II visit the gift shop, where I suggest you pick up a copy of All Our Animals, a guidebook that has beautiful pictures of the animals you'll see today. Q3 And please remember, don't make phone calls on your cell phone during the tour.

question.text: According to the speaker, what is impressive about the zoo?
choices: (A) It was featured in a documentary.
(B) It is fully funded by the government.

question.text: What does the speaker recommend doing after the tour?
What does the speaker say is not allowed during the tour?

answer.explanation: Thanks for coming to today’s meeting. Q1 First, I’d like to congratulate you on the Rivera Shoes account. As you know, last quarter our agency launched an ad campaign for our client Rivera Athletic Shoes. It featured soccer star Giovanni Casati. Q2 Today I can share with you the news that since those ads were released, Rivera has been sales increase by almost forty percent. I’ve been in this industry a long time, and I’ve never seen anything like it. To keep the momentum going, we’re going to bring back Giovanni for another series of ads. Q3 His training schedule is pretty tight, but we’re hoping to set up a photo shoot with him sometime in April.

question.text: Where do the listeners most likely work?
What does the speaker imply when he says, “I’ve never seen anything like it”?
choices: (A) He is impressed by some news.
(B) He is unfamiliar with a product.
(C) He is confused by a suggestion.
(D) He is looking for some sales figures.

answer.text: (A) He is impressed by some news.

question.text: What does the speaker hope to schedule in April?

answer.explanation: Hi, Ms. Patel. This is Shelly from Valley Landscape Company. Q1 l was working on your property today, and I took a look at the area where you wanted me to plant a flower garden. Q1&2 Well, the problem is, that area doesn't get much sun, so only a few types of flowers will grow there. I know you really liked the flowers you chose for that spot, but I hope you can be flexible. Q3 l left a catalog in your mailbox, and I suggest you look it over. I’d like to finish landscaping your yard this week, so please call me back and let me know your decision as soon as possible.

question.text: Why is the speaker calling the customer?
choices: (A) To discuss a problem with a project
(D) To apologize for a delayed order

answer.text: (A) To discuss a problem with a project

question.text: What does the speaker imply when she says hope you can be flexible ?
choices: (A) A different worker will complete a project.
(B)  A deadline will not be met.
(C) A product selection should be changed
(D) A price is higher than expected.

answer.text: (C) A product selection should be changed

question.text: What did the speaker leave for the customer?

answer.explanation: Q1 Before we conclude this management meeting, I want to remind you that the company 's computer network will be unavailable starting Friday evening at eight o’clock. Our technology service team will be installing several software updates over the weekend and should be finished by Sunday. Q2 There are special instructions for shutting down computers on Friday and logging back into the system on Monday, so I’d like each of you to e-mail the employees you manage to let them know. I’ll forward you the link to the instructions right after this meeting. Q3 If you get any questions related to this update, please ask employees to contact Oliver Wilson, the IT specialist in charge of this project.

answer.explanation: Can I have everyone's attention at the front of the bus? Well, I hope you enjoyed your lunch at Emmon’s Cafe. As I mentioned earlier, Q1 it first opened in 1882, and has been operating longer than any other restaurant in Carter City. Q2 Now, if you look out the windows on the left, you'll see that we're entering the Carter Nature Preserve. And according to our schedule, we're right on time. We’ll be spending about two hours here, and it might rain so be sure to grab your jackets. Q3 As you get off the bus. I'll pass out booklets with information about the plants and birds you'll be seeing in the preserve.

question.text: What does the speaker say about Emmon's Cafe?
choices: (B) It has multiple locations in the area.
(C)  It is the oldest restaurant in the city.
(D) It has recently won an award.

answer.text: (C)  It is the oldest restaurant in the city.

answer.explanation: And now for the Radford City sports news! Q1 We were all disappointed that the championship basketball game between our own Eagles and the Bulldogs was canceled last Saturday night because of the big snow storm. The game has been rescheduled for this Thursday evening at seven o'clock at the Radford Arena. Tickets are going fast, but Q2 don’t worry if you can't get a ticket-you can watch the game on the local television channel . Snow removal is ongoing, and all parking areas at the arena will be open except one. Q3 The area that’ll be closed is the one closest to Main Street. Go Eagles!

question.text: Why was a basketball game rescheduled?
According to the speaker, why might a listener watch a game on television?
choices: (B) If tickets have been sold out
(C) If there is no available parking
(D) If the game is being played out of town

answer.text: (B) If tickets have been sold out

question.text: Look at the graphic. Which parking area will be closed?

answer.explanation: Hi Ms Xiao. Q1 This is Franklin Moore calling from Franklin Auto Express. I found the problem with your car’s air conditioner – you’ve got a bad sensor switch, which needs to be replaced. Q2 I ordered the part this morning, but it won’t arrive at the shop until tomorrow. Q3 So if you’d like, we can offer to lend you a car to use until your car is fixed. Please give me a call back at 555-0101

answer.explanation: Good morning. Q1&2 I called this meeting to discuss how all cashiers at our store should interact with customers. I’ve noticed that some of you are so focused on scanning items and getting people through the line quickly, that you’re ignoring the customers. We want to leave customer at our supermarket with good impression, so it’s crucial that you greet them. Be sure to be pleasant when they arrive at your cash register. Q3 I’m now going to have you work in pairs to play the part of the cashier and customer to practice being friendly, while also being fast and efficient.
